zone.line: And nears itself to your lungs —
From If itself the South from the wilderness calls
Heat upon heat on thy skull is heaped
So brings the West the swarms, which first ?arch
And Around the both field & meadow to drown
They hear willingly, to mischief joyful go,
They hearken willingly, while they us willingly decieve,
They appear as from Heaven sent
And lisp like angels when they lie,
Yet walk we! dark is already the world,
The air is felt, the mist falls!
At evening values one first the house.
Why standest thou thus, & lookest astonied up
What canst theeee in the twilight so attract
Faust
Seest thou that black dog, thro corn & stubble run
Wagner
he to me
I have seen him long already, nothing important seems
Faust
Consider him well, for what holdest thou the beast
